title: Do the rocks have a name in Keen 4?
content:
You know those rocks that creep up on you when you're looking the other way, and then jump on you? Do they have a name or are they just "rocks"?

(Yes I was about to create a page in the wiki for them...)

title: Re: Do the rocks have a name in Keen 4?
content: They're called Mimrocks, I think.

title: Re: Do the rocks have a name in Keen 4?
content:
Mimrocks, it's the name we use for them. I'm not sure if it's the official name though, but I haven't seen any place in the web using a different name, so it must be the official name.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
Aren't these listed in the "Help!" section of Keen4, when you press F1 on the Main Menu?

title: Re: ...
content:
Nope.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img] ------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

content:

title: Re: ...
content: Couldn't you of just looked at the Keencyclopedia on Spatang?

title: Re: ...
content:
Yes, but those aren't all the real names.
I think the two made up names are Mimrock and Stranded Fish. All others are real, or just simple names (like Bird).-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: ...
content:
Mimrock's the name I've always heard being used. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: ...
content: Well, it's [url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Mimrock]Mimrock[/url] in the wiki now!  (Even if the article content still needs some work.)

title: huh
content:
Ok, you're right SM, I went and checked the Keen4 help file; no sign of them! How weird!

I went to GameFAQs and checked their repotoire--Flaose used 'Mimrock' in his FAQ back in 2003, so the name has been in common use for at least 4 years. Admittedly, the other FAQs title them "False Rocks" or "Fake Rocks."

I could have sworn that 'Mimrock' was documented somewhere.

Edit: HAHA~!!! I found it. It's in the Official Hint Sheet that came with Secret of the Oracle. The one that has the following list:

There are seven free Keens on level 1.
You can get to the top of the Pyramid of the Moons.
We're talking the OUTSIDE.
There is a hidden area at the top of the Cave of the
Descendants.
Princess Lindsey appears twice.
In the Chasm of Chills, a slug holds a secret.
There's stuff hidden very well in Highville. All you need is a
flash of insight.
There's a free Keen in Miragia.
There's a free Keen in the Pyramid of the Ancients.
There's a free Keen on the Isle of Fire.
There are at least seven free Keens in the Pyramid of the
Shadows.
You can get to the secret pyramid by way of something in
the Pyramid of the Moons. Reread the Cast of Characters
carefully.
Dopefish also like to eat the small schoolfish that follow you.
Pressing button 1 makes you swim faster.
You can squash skypests by jumping on them with your
pogo stick while they are preening,
You can only shoot mimrocks when they are jumping at you.
Mad Mushrooms leap higher on the third bounce.

title: Re: huh
content:
I had a feeling it would be there... I didn't bother to check, though...

Highville?-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: it's
content: Hillville.

title: Re: it's
content:
I know that. But you think they'd double-check those things? It's interesting, though. That might have been an earlier name for the level...-Genius314

title: Re: it's
content:
Quite possibly, it's in some hills, hills are high, also, you have to go up high to get stuff. How very interesting!

These hint sheets and such need to be included in the wiki.

title: Re: it's
content:

Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: it's
content: I think that's a deliberate typo - the "stuff hidden in Highville" is hidden up high in Hillville...

title: Hah...
content: That's interesting... I was certain the Mimrocks were mentioned in the help file. I'd never even read that hint sheet, so it must have sunk in through the years of hanging around in this community.

title: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
While on the subject of names for things...

Those hopping annoying things in the pyramid of the Gnosticene Ancients...are they actually called Gnosticene ancients? That's the name I've always heard for them, but I didn't know if there was another name or not.

title: Re: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
Their official name is 'Treasure Eater'. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Yeah, the lamest name in the series perhaps. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
I've seen them called Smirky, which I think is much better. (Heck, even Gnosticene Ancients would be better.)[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
Yeah, definitely agree, but this is the official name (unless my memory is fucled up). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
Official my tush! If Norp works, so does Smirky.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
I've never heard that official name KeenRush. Do you remember where you got it from?--------------------

content:
I've heard it before, but I never knew it was the official name.

And, I must say, Smirky is the best name I've yet heard for them. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: Red happy fishie dudes
content:
From the Keencyclopaedia:
[quote]Quote:[hr]They have been called Gnosticene Ancients in the past, but a quick e-mail to Tom Hall fixed that.[hr][/quote][url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Gnosticine Ancients
content:
But isn't the pyramid that they're found in called the Pyramid of the Gnosticene Ancients? THAT must be the official name, cuz I've never heard of 'treasure eater' b4, and certainly not in the cannon games, but at least this is in the cannon.

On the other hand, I'd very much like a link to the article where Tom 'cleared it up'.
"Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?" The official searched through his papers momentarily.
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe." No one in the room had any immediate comment.

title: Re: Gnosticine Ancients
content:
"But isn't the pyramid that they're found in called the Pyramid of the Gnosticene Ancients? THAT must be the official name, cuz I've never heard of 'treasure eater' b4, and certainly not in the cannon games, but at least this is in the cannon."
Yes, so did I think before too. And that'd make a lot sense. However, it's never mentioned in the games that those things are the Gnosticene Ancients, so one can't say it's canon. And as said, Tom cleared it up and said they're Treasure Eaters.

"On the other hand, I'd very much like a link to the article where Tom 'cleared it up'."
It's some e-mail (as said on previous page), but I don't have it... And if I remember correct, which may not be, there long long long ago was some topic where it was posted, or something. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Gnosticine Ancients
content:
Proof! Proof!Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Gnosticine Ancients
content:
I'd like to contact Tom Hall to settle this once and for all. If we do contact him, we may as well get everything sorted out, so can anyone think of any other questions to ask? The only ones I can think of are:

- What's the proper name for Treasure Eaters
- What's the name of the gun Keen uses in episodes two and three
- Is "Spot" really the name of Keen's pet Yorp

I'm a little reluctant to ask that last one as it seems a bit silly to me, but nevertheless it was raised on the KeenWiki...[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Gnosticine Ancients
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]- What's the name of the gun Keen uses in episodes two and three[hr][/quote]

I wasn't aware that that is/was an issue. It says in the story of K2 that he found a nearly empty Vorticon HyperPistol, and I could have sworn the K3 gun is called a Vorticon Rail-Gun (can't find it in the story, but it's in keencyclopedia at least, so it had to come from somewhere).

Are these guns called by other names somewhere else in the games and thus conflict with each other? That's the only way I can see that these aren't official."Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?" The official searched through his papers momentarily.
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe." No one in the room had any immediate comment.

title: Re: Treasure Eaters
content:
"Proof! Proof!"
As I said in other topic, it's not me who made this up, so I'm not entitled to provide any evidence -- which I would if it had been me who sent that e-mail. But I believe the topic is long gone. Malv (and LL), I think the correct name is Treasure Eaters -- too lazy to repeat everything I've said already, so I just quote myself from that other topic: "It wasn't me who first said they are Treasure Eaters. But I can't remember who the garg it was. Anyways, xtra's Beyond the Pogo mentions this e-mail too, and the data was written there already few years ago, I think. (Or it may even be from the original Keencyclopedia, which is even earlier.) Treasure Eater is the term I've heard is the right one, and told by Tom himself. If that's lie -- well, then it is, but as long as someone sends Tom e-mail about it again, I keep the e-mail in question to be true, and consider their name really is TE. This TE is NOT my invention. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] "3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Gnosticine Ancients
content:
Oh you're right, I forgot we'd cleared up the confusion about the HyperPistol in Keen 2 - but yes, there was some discussion on the wiki about where the name of the Vorticon Rail-Gun came from, and the only answer seemed to be from the Keencyclopedia...

And sorry KR, I'm not disputing the Treasure Eater name, I too recall something about an e-mail from Tom Hall - so I was simply thinking that if we've got some other questions to ask, we may as well re-ask that one so that we've got something we can point to next time someone asks the question![url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]
